contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Chinese|title=Chen Fan|t=趙忠|s=赵忠|p=Zhào Zhōng}} '''Zhào Zhōng''' (趙忠) (died 189) was a [[Eunuch (court official)|eunuch]] of the late [[Han Dynasty]], who served [[Emperor Ling of Han]] the [[Ten regular attendants]] (Also known as the Ten Eunuchs). The eunuchs who had gained considerable power in the Han imperial court. When [[He Jin]] attempted to assassinate all the palace eunuchs it was Zhao Zhong and Zhang Rang who were the ones who beheaded him in the palace courtyard ==See also== '''other ten regular attendants:''' *[[Zhang Rang]] *[[Cheng Kuang]] *[[Duan Gui]] *[[Feng Xu]] *[[Guo Sheng (eunuch)|Guo Sheng]] *[[Hou Lan]] *[[Jian Shuo]] *[[Cao Jie (eunuch)|Cao Jie]] *[[Xia Yun]] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Zhao, Zhong | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Han Dynasty Eunuch | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 189 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Zhao, Zhong}} [[Category:Han Dynasty eunuchs related to the Three Kingdoms]] [[Category:189 deaths]] [[Category:Han Dynasty politicians]] [[Category:Politicians from Hebei]] [[Category:2nd-century births]] [[Category:People executed by the Han Dynasty by decapitation]] [[Category:Han Dynasty people executed by decapitation]] [[Category:People from Hebei executed by decapitation]] [[Category:2nd-century executions]]
